body:
Despite the many problems with how the Linux contributing process is setup, I do think one of the "Things That Works" is the concept of subsystems and maintainers of those subsystems. This would mean _if_ `mobile` was considered a subsystem for go packages, it would have maintainers with expertise in that area. Maybe they wrote the package to begin with. Maybe they have contributed heavily after it was open-sourced. They would not be responsible for anything else (unless they had other expertise and were willing). Same goes for `usb` if that is deemed a subsystem. 
I agree this shouldn't be for "Yet Another Framework". It should really only be used for low-level core libraries. You could almost make the analogy that "Debian" is not a subsystem of Linux ;) it merely uses it :)
